info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 10 at 3:21AM AKDT until July 12 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, AND 224... .DISCUSSION... A thermal trough stretching from McGrath to Fairbanks to Eagle will persist into Monday. This, along with a warm and unstable airmass and shortwaves aloft moving west across Eastern Interior over the next several days will be the perfect receipt for continued thunderstorm activity. The threat will consist of isolated thunderstorms across the Eastern Interior, with scattered thunderstorms in the afternoon/evening over the area south of Fort Yukon through Monday night. Expect 3000 to 5000 lightning strokes each day. In addition, these troughs will cause significant rain showers over areas southeast of a line from Eagle to Kantishna through Monday night. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT MONDAY NIGHT FOR LIGHTNING FOR YUKON FLATS AND SURROUNDING UPLANDS... * AFFECTED AREA...Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands. * TIMING...Until Midnight AKDT Monday night. * LIGHTNING ACTIVITY LEVEL...4. * WINDS...Northeast 5 to 10 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 27 percent. * TEMPERATURES...75 to 85. * IMPACTS...Ample lightning could lead to numerous new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
